title: COMP/STAT112 Notebook
text:
Introduction
This is my online notebook for COMP/STAT112 course taken at Macalester College. Please, use the side bar on the left for navigation. hello

title: 4  9-4 Entry
text: 4.1 I should’ve started with this course instead of STAT 155…I’m starting the semester learning what code means, instead of how to use it.

title: 5  9-6-24 Entry
text:
Cmd+shift+I is a shortcut for new R code in qmd Unclear what “” does in qmd… “!” takes it from url–>image “[]” becomes the caption for the image Make sure to leave spaces between code (e.g. “x = 100” as opposed to “x=100”) “jo_scare”= “snake case”
Why “qmd”? markdown(formats, but doesn’t run code)–>Rmarkdown(runs R code)–>Quarto Markdown (works with multiple coding languages–Python, Java, and Julia)

title: 6  9-10-24 entry
text:
a frame: variables/features that define the axes of the canvas
a layer: geometric elements added to the canvas to represent data points/patterns (e.g. lines, points)

sometimes called “geoms”/“glyphs” (like hieroglyph)

scales: aesthetics added to geom elements (e.g. color, shape)
faceting: splitting up of data into subplots/facets to examine groups w/in the data
a theme: controls of finer points of plot aesthetics (e.g. font type, background, etc)
